intro: Ecclinusa costata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf ecclinusa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wavy margins on its leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ecclinusa costata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
